dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis is first and foremost a TypeScript plugin for Rollup that brings the best of both together in a package that also respects \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist\"\u003eBrowserslists\u003c/a\u003e, bundles declaration files, and enables seamless integration with other transpilers such as \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBabel\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://swc.rs/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eswc\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOne of the most powerful features of \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e is declaration bundling and tree-shaking that works seamlessly with code splitting. That means you'll always get the smallest possible declaration files that match exactly what you're exporting, without any superflous type information.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTooling in the JavaScript ecosystem can often be complex, and this is very much the case when intending to combine TypeScript with other tools such as Babel and Browserslists while still maintaining the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28/hovercard\"\u003eunique emit capabilities of \u003ccode\u003etsc\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e differs from other TypeScript plugins in being opiniated about how some of these tools integrate in order to achieve the most optimal behavior with the smallest possible computational overhead. For example, when combined with another transpiler such as Babel, TypeScript handles diagnostics and declarations, while Babel is used for part of or all of the syntax transformations. You can even configure which transpiler takes care of the TypeScript-specific syntax, and which transpiler takes care of the remaining syntax. For example, you can let the TypeScript compiler strip away type information, while handling the rest of the syntax transformation with babel or swc.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAt the same time, \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e has a very robust test suite that runs tests across all minor versions of TypeScript since v3.4 to ensure that everything works no matter which version of TypeScript you or your team is using.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" applications and libraries with Rollup\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGenerates, bundles, and tree-shakes declaration files (\u003ccode\u003e.d.ts\u003c/code\u003e) and fully supports code splitting.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntegrates seamlessly with other transpilers such as \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBabel\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://swc.rs/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eswc\u003c/a\u003e, such that TypeScript handles diagnostics, declarations, and another transpiler is used for parts of or the entire syntax transformation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEmits Compiler diagnostics and brings them into the Rollup build lifecycle\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCorrectly handles \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28/hovercard\"\u003eEmit-less types\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports Incremental compilation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist\"\u003eBrowserslist\u003c/a\u003e can be provided instead of a target version of ECMAScript such that your code is transpiled in relation to the baseline of browsers defined in your Browserslist instead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRobust, with a comprehensive test suite that runs against all minor versions of TypeScript from v3.4 and up.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBackers\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca on \u003ccode\u003erollup\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etypescript\u003c/code\u003e, so you need to manually install these as development dependencies as well.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou may also need to install additional peer dependencies such as \u003ccode\u003e@babel/core\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/runtime\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-typescript\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-transform-runtime\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@swc/core\u003c/code\u003e, or \u003ccode\u003e@swc/helpers\u003c/code\u003e depending on the features you are going to use. Refer to the documentation for the specific cases where any of these may be relevant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsage\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-usage\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Usage\" href=\"#usage\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing the plugin is as simple as it can be. Here's an example within a Rollup config:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"import ts from \u0026quot;rollup-plugin-ts\u0026quot;;\nexport default {\n\t// ...\n\tplugins: [\n\t\tts({\n\t\t\t/* Plugin options */\n\t\t})\n\t]\n};\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efrom\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"rollup-plugin-ts\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eexport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003edefault\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// ...\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eplugins\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e[\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e/* Plugin options */\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWithout any options, the plugin will \u003cem\u003e\"just work\"\u003c/em\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etsconfig.json\u003c/code\u003e file closest to the current working directory will be resolved, if any. Otherwise, the default Typescript options will be used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003e.browserslistrc\u003c/code\u003e file or \u003ccode\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/code\u003e property within the \u003ccode\u003epackage.json\u003c/code\u003e file closest to the current working directory will be resolved and used to decide the Typescript ECMAScript version target, if any. Otherwise, the declared \u003ccode\u003etarget\u003c/code\u003e within the resolved \u003ccode\u003etsconfig.json\u003c/code\u003e file will be used, if any such file exists, and if not, the default Typescript target will be used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing it with just Typescript\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-using-it-with-just-typescript\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Using it with just Typescript\" href=\"#using-it-with-just-typescript\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin works very well with just Typescript.\nThe \u003ccode\u003etsconfig.json\u003c/code\u003e file closest to your project will be resolved and used in combination with Rollup.\nIf your config has a different name, or if you use different configs dynamically depending on the environment, you can provide the location for the \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e in the plugin options:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttsconfig: PRODUCTION ? \u0026quot;tsconfig.prod.json\u0026quot; : \u0026quot;tsconfig.json\u0026quot;\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etsconfig\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ePRODUCTION\u003c/span\u003e ? \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"tsconfig.prod.json\"\u003c/span\u003e : \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"tsconfig.json\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou an also pass in \u003ca href=\"https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eCompilerOptions\u003c/a\u003e directly, rather than provide the path to a \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttsconfig: {\n\t\ttarget: ScriptTarget.ES2018,\n\t\tallowSyntheticDefaultImports: true,\n\t\tallowJs: true\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etsconfig\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etarget\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eScriptTarget\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eES2018\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eallowSyntheticDefaultImports\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etrue\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eallowJs\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etrue\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can also pass in a function that receives whatever \u003ccode\u003eCompilerOptions\u003c/code\u003e that could be resolved relative to the current working directory, but then allow you to override the options:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttsconfig: resolvedConfig =\u0026gt; ({...resolvedConfig, allowJs: false})\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003etsconfig\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eresolvedConfig\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e...\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eresolvedConfig\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eallowJs\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003efalse\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe above example is based on the assumption that a file can be resolved with the name \u003ccode\u003etsconfig.json\u003c/code\u003e, and if not, the Typescript's default \u003ccode\u003eCompilerOptions\u003c/code\u003e will be used.\nBut if you want to provide the name of the \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e to override, you can also pass in an object following the following form:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttsconfig: {\n\t\tfileName: \u0026quot;my-awesome-tsconfig.json\u0026quot;,\n\t\thook: resolvedConfig =\u0026gt; ({...resolvedConfig, allowJs: false})\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etsconfig\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003efileName\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"my-awesome-tsconfig.json\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ehook\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eresolvedConfig\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e...\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eresolvedConfig\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eallowJs\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003efalse\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf there is a \u003ccode\u003e.browserslistrc\u003c/code\u003e file or the nearest \u003ccode\u003epackage.json\u003c/code\u003e contains a Browserslist configuration, a target ECMAScript version will be decided based on that one, rather than respecting the \u003ccode\u003etarget\u003c/code\u003e property of the matched \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e.\nIf you do not want this behavior, you can \u003ca href=\"#using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists\"\u003edisable it as described here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin makes sure that the helper functions that may be emitted within the output generated by Typescript will not be duplicated across files and chunks. Instead, they will automatically be divided into chunks and imported across Rollup chunks.\nYou don't have to do anything!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCombining Typescript with a Browserslist\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-combining-typescript-with-a-browserslist\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Combining Typescript with a Browserslist\" href=\"#combining-typescript-with-a-browserslist\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf there is a \u003ccode\u003e.browserslistrc\u003c/code\u003e file or the nearest \u003ccode\u003epackage.json\u003c/code\u003e contains a Browserslist configuration, this is the default behavior! Rather than use the \u003ccode\u003etarget\u003c/code\u003e property of the nearest \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e, it will be decided based on the Browserslist.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can explicitly pass in Browserslist options. Here's an example with a raw Browserslist query:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\tbrowserslist: [\u0026quot;last 1 version\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;\u0026gt; 1%\u0026quot;]\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e[\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"last 1 version\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"\u0026gt; 1%\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can also provide a configuration object instead of a raw query. Here's one with a baked-in query:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\tbrowserslist: {\n\t\tquery: [\u0026quot;last 1 version\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;\u0026gt; 1%\u0026quot;]\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003equery\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e[\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"last 1 version\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"\u0026gt; 1%\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e...And here's one with a \u003ccode\u003epath\u003c/code\u003e property pointing to a file that contains a Browserslist:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\tbrowserslist: {\n\t\tpath: \u0026quot;.mybrowserslistrc\u0026quot;\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003epath\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\".mybrowserslistrc\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing the plugin with Typescript, but without Browserslists\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Using the plugin with Typescript, but without Browserslists\" href=\"#using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf no Browserslist can be found, or if you simply don't want to use one, that's completely OK!\nIn such cases, the \u003ccode\u003etarget\u003c/code\u003e property of the nearest \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e will be used (or use the Typescript default setting if no such file exists).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can explicitly request that no Browserslist will be used by setting the \u003ccode\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/code\u003e property to \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e in the plugin options:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\tbrowserslist: false\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003efalse\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCombining Typescript with Babel\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-combining-typescript-with-babel\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Combining Typescript with Babel\" href=\"#combining-typescript-with-babel\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin makes it really easy to use Typescript for reporting diagnostics and generating declaration files, but then using Babel for all syntax transformations.\nOne very strong use case for this is to use \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Another one is that you get the entire ecosystem of Babel plugins at your disposal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo use Babel, first set the \u003ccode\u003etranspiler\u003c/code\u003e plugin option to \u003ccode\u003e\"babel\"\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttranspiler: \u0026quot;babel\u0026quot;\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etranspiler\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"babel\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNow, all that remains is to simply install the peer dependencies relevant to \u003ccode\u003ebabel\u003c/code\u003e. Please install \u003ccode\u003e@babel/core\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/runtime\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-transform-runtime\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-typescript\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e as well with your package manager:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enpm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ npm install @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ npm install @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYarn\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ yarn add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ yarn add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epnpm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ pnpm add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ pnpm add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDon't worry if you don't, \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e will warn you about exactly which dependencies are missing once you run it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOnce you're done installing peer dependencies, that's it! The plugin will attempt to locate a \u003ccode\u003ebabel.config.js\u003c/code\u003e file or a \u003ccode\u003e.babelrc\u003c/code\u003e file and use the options, plugins, and presets found there.\nBy default, some combination of presets and plugins will be applied depending on the config options you provide, while others will be forced at all times for interoperability reasons. See \u003ca href=\"#default-babel-plugins\"\u003ethis section\u003c/a\u003e for more details.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e behavior (and how to opt out)\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-babelpreset-env-behavior-and-how-to-opt-out\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: @babel/preset-env behavior (and how to opt out)\" href=\"#babelpreset-env-behavior-and-how-to-opt-out\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, when using Babel as the transpiler, \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e will be used as a preset that respects the browserslist that was either provided directly as a plugin option, or was resolved inside the root of your project, or was computed based on your \u003ccode\u003etsconfig.json\u003c/code\u003e file.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you don't want this behavior, simply pass the \u003ccode\u003ebrowserslist: false\u003c/code\u003e option to the plugin. Doing so will never apply \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e and not apply any additional syntax transformations:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttranspiler: \u0026quot;babel\u0026quot;,\n\tbrowserslist: false\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etranspiler\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"babel\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebrowserslist\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003efalse\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eSpecial handling for minification plugins/presets\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-special-handling-for-minification-pluginspresets\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Special handling for minification plugins/presets\" href=\"#special-handling-for-minification-pluginspresets\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin will apply syntax transformations from Babel presets and plugins on a file-by-file basis. However, if a minification-related plugin or preset such as \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/babel/minify/tree/master/packages/babel-preset-minify\"\u003ebabel-preset-minify\u003c/a\u003e is found within the Babel options,\nthese transformations will be applied per chunk. This enables the minification presets and plugins to perform better as it can now mangle in relation to the entire chunk and better remove unwanted characters such as whitespace.\nAll of this works automatically.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/runtime\u003c/code\u003e and external helpers\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-babelruntime-and-external-helpers\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: @babel/runtime and external helpers\" href=\"#babelruntime-and-external-helpers\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin will automatically make sure to avoid duplication of emitted Babel helpers. Rollup will automatically split these into chunks and re-use them across the chunks that Rollup generates.\nYou don't have to do anything.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/runtime\u003c/code\u003e and polyfills\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-babelruntime-and-polyfills\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: @babel/runtime and polyfills\" href=\"#babelruntime-and-polyfills\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBabel supports injecting polyfills where needed and in relation to the target environment. By default, this plugin \u003cstrong\u003ewill not\u003c/strong\u003e add polyfills to your chunks since there are arguably better ways of applying polyfills such as lazy-loading depending on feature support or using something like \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/wessberg/polyfiller\"\u003ePolyfill.app\u003c/a\u003e.\nIf you would like this behavior, simply add either \u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-transform-runtime\u003c/code\u003e to your Babel config with the \u003ccode\u003ecorejs\u003c/code\u003e option set to true, or add \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e to your Babel config with the \u003ccode\u003euseBuiltIns\u003c/code\u003e option set to \u003ccode\u003eusage\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCombining Typescript with swc\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-combining-typescript-with-swc\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Combining Typescript with swc\" href=\"#combining-typescript-with-swc\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eJust like with \u003ca href=\"#combining-typescript-with-babel\"\u003eBabel\u003c/a\u003e, this plugin makes it trivial to use TypeScript for reporting diagnostics, generating declaration files, and stripping types, but then using swc for all other syntax transformations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSwc is a much faster alternative to Babel, built in Rust, that attempts to be as close to a drop-in replacement for Babel as possible. It is not nearly as mature and doesn't have as big a plugin ecosystem yet, but can often be much faster than Babel. And like Babel, it also has \u003ca href=\"https://swc.rs/docs/configuration/supported-browsers\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003efirst-class support for Browserslists\u003c/a\u003e which will be used to decide which syntax transformations to apply depending on language support in the target environments.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo use swc, first set the \u003ccode\u003etranspiler\u003c/code\u003e plugin option to \u003ccode\u003e\"swc\"\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttranspiler: \u0026quot;swc\u0026quot;\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etranspiler\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"swc\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNow, all that remains is to simply install the peer dependencies relevant to \u003ccode\u003eswc\u003c/code\u003e. Please install \u003ccode\u003e@swc/core\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e@swc/helpers\u003c/code\u003e as well with your package manager:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enpm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ npm install @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ npm install @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYarn\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ yarn add @swc/core @swc/helpers --dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ yarn add @swc/core @swc/helpers --dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epnpm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ pnpm add @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e$ pnpm add @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDon't worry if you don't, \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e will warn you about exactly which dependencies are missing once you run it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOnce you're done installing peer dependencies, that's it! The plugin will attempt to locate a \u003ccode\u003e.swcrc\u003c/code\u003e file and use the options found there.\nBy default, some combination of options will be applied depending on the config options you provide, while others will be forced at all times for interoperability reasons. See \u003ca href=\"#default-babel-plugins\"\u003ethis section\u003c/a\u003e for more details.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eMixing transpilers\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-mixing-transpilers\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Mixing transpilers\" href=\"#mixing-transpilers\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, the transpiler you select, such as \u003ccode\u003etypescript\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ebabel\u003c/code\u003e, or \u003ccode\u003eswc\u003c/code\u003e, is used for the entire syntax transformation. However, you may want to mix these. There can be quite good reasons why you may want that, \u003ca href=\"#okay-then-why-wouldnt-you-use-just-babel\"\u003eas described here\u003c/a\u003e.\nIn short, you may find value in using the TypeScript compiler for stripping away the TypeScript specific syntax, and then delegate the remaining syntax transformations to swc or babel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo accomplish this, the \u003ccode\u003etranspiler\u003c/code\u003e option also allows for an options record:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\ttranspiler: {\n\t\ttypescriptSyntax: \u0026quot;typescript\u0026quot;,\n\t\totherSyntax: \u0026quot;babel\u0026quot;\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ets\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etranspiler\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etypescriptSyntax\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"typescript\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eotherSyntax\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"babel\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn this example, the TypeScript compiler will first remove features such as types, type-only imports, enums, and decorators.\nBabel will then be used for all other syntax transformation from then on, depending on the combination of default, provided, and forced presets and plugins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsing \u003ccode\u003eCustom Transformers\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-using-custom-transformers\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Using Custom Transformers\" href=\"#using-custom-transformers\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin enables you to pass in \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/13940\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/microsoft/TypeScript/pull/13940/hovercard\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCustom Transformers\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e which allows you to transform the Typescript AST during code transpilation.\nThis enables you to very efficiently transform Typescript before code generation and additionally enables you to use this plugin with tools that leverage this, such as some modern web frameworks and libraries do.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePlease note that if you want to combine Custom Transformers with other transpilers such as \u003ccode\u003ebabel\u003c/code\u003e, you must mix them such that the \u003ccode\u003etypeScript\u003c/code\u003e transpiler is used for the \u003ccode\u003etypescriptSyntax\u003c/code\u003e option as \u003ca href=\"#mixing-transpilers\"\u003edescribed above\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeclaration files\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-declaration-files\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Declaration files\" href=\"#declaration-files\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTypescript declaration files are normally distributed in a folder structure that resembles the structure of the source folder.\nWith \u003ccode\u003etsc\u003c/code\u003e, you would get something like this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/tsc-output-example.png\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"TSC emitted code\" src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/tsc-output-example.png\" height=\"250\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRollup is a bundler, and with it, we can produce clean, small files that are easy to distribute.\nWith \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e, declaration files will be bundled, tree-shaken and emitted alongside the chunks emitted by Rollup:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example.png\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Plugin emitted code\" src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example.png\" height=\"250\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAnd, it even works in complex code splitting scenarios:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example-code-splitting.png\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Plugin emitted code with code splitting\" src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example-code-splitting.png\" height=\"250\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eif you're using TypeScript v4.7 or newer, the extension of your declaration files will depend on the extensions of your output files as controlled by your Rollup config:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e.js\u003c/code\u003e output files will produce \u003ccode\u003e.d.ts\u003c/code\u003e and optionally \u003ccode\u003e.d.ts.map\u003c/code\u003e files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e.mjs\u003c/code\u003e output files will produce \u003ccode\u003e.d.mts\u003c/code\u003e and optionally \u003ccode\u003e.d.mts.map\u003c/code\u003e files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e.cjs\u003c/code\u003e output files will produce \u003ccode\u003e.d.cts\u003c/code\u003e and optionally \u003ccode\u003e.d.cts.map\u003c/code\u003e files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" \"buildInfo\") =\u0026gt; string | undefined\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eoutputPath\u003c/code\u003e hook can be used to rewrite the location on the filesystem that assets produced by \u003ccode\u003erollup-plugin-ts\u003c/code\u003e are written to.\nIt is invoked immediately before assets such as \u003cem\u003edeclarations\u003c/em\u003e or \u003cem\u003edeclaration maps\u003c/em\u003e are emitted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe hook is invoked with the output path as well as the kind of asset the path represents as arguments.\nIf you return a \u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e from the hook, the alternative location will be used instead. If you return undefined, the current path will be used.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"ts({\n\thook: {\n\t\toutputPath: (path, kind) =\u0026gt; rewritePathSomehow(path, kind)\n\t}\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003erewritePathSomehow\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan Diagnostic[]|undefined\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003ediagnostics\u003c/code\u003e hook can be used to read, alter, and extend the diagnostics generated by TypeScript immediately before they are emitted as errors via Rollup.\nNormally, Rollup will crash on the first discovered error, but there may be several diagnostics, all of which may be of interest to you. This hook gives you access to all of them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can also use this hook if you want to silence specific kinds of Diagnostics or even add your own.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003edeclarationStats\u003c/code\u003e hook\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-the-declarationstats-hook\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: The declarationStats hook\" href=\"#the-declarationstats-hook\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eType: \u003ccode\u003e(stats: DeclarationStats) =\u0026gt; DeclarationStats|undefined\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003edeclarationStats\u003c/code\u003e hook can be used to get relevant stats produced while bundling declarations.\nThe hook calls the given callback with a stats object as the first argument.\nThe stats object has the following type information:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"// A Record from chunk file names to their stats\ntype DeclarationStats = Record\u0026lt;string, DeclarationChunkStats\u0026gt;;\n\ninterface DeclarationChunkStats {\n\t// An array of the external type dependencies for a declaration chunk\n\texternalTypes: ExternalType[];\n}\n\ninterface ExternalType {\n\t// The name of the external library that provides the typings. For example, \u0026quot;typescript\u0026quot; or \u0026quot;@types/node\u0026quot;\n\tlibrary: string;\n\t// The version of the referenced external library\n\tversion: string;\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// A Record from chunk file names to their stats\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003etype\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eDeclarationStats\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eRecord\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003estring\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eDeclarationChunkStats\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003einterface\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eDeclarationChunkStats\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// An array of the external type dependencies for a declaration chunk\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eexternalTypes\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eExternalType\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e[\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003einterface\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eExternalType\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n\t\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// The name of the external library that provides the typings. Combined with Rollup, they become even more powerful.\nTo provide a seamless experience, Rollup always take precedence when conflicts arise. As a natural consequence of this, some options provided to TypeScript and Babel will be ignored or overridden.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following \u003ca href=\"https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eCompilerOptions\u003c/a\u003e from a \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e will be ignored:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eProperty\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReason\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoutDir\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup, not TypeScript, will decide where to emit chunks.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003emodule\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup, not TypeScript, is the decider of which module system(s) to target based on your Rollup configuration.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoutFile\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThis option produces flat output and only works with the module formats AMD and SystemJS. Rollup will be the decider of how to split code.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003esourceMap\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTypeScript will always be instructed to produce SourceMaps. Rollup then decides whether or not to include them (and if they should be inlined).\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003einlineSourceMap\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTypeScript will always be instructed to produce SourceMaps. Rollup then decides whether or not to include them (and if they should be inlined).\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003einlineSources\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSince \u003ccode\u003einlineSourceMap\u003c/code\u003e is ignored, this option won't take effect.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eimportHelpers\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eHelpers will always be imported. This makes it possible for Rollup to code-split properly and share TypeScript helpers across chunks.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003emoduleResolution\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eNode-module resolution will always be used. This is required for \u003ccode\u003eimportHelpers\u003c/code\u003e to work and in general, to make TypeScript able to resolve external libraries. Note that you still need to add the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-node-resolve\"\u003enodeResolve\u003c/a\u003e plugin in order to include external libraries within your bundle unless \u003ccode\u003eallowJs\u003c/code\u003e is \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e within your \u003ccode\u003etsconfig\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003enoEmit\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTypeScript should always be able to emit assets, but those will be delegated to Rollup.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003enoEmitOnError\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eemitDeclarationOnly\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003enoEmitHelpers\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTypeScript should always be able to emit helpers, since the \u003ccode\u003eimportHelpers\u003c/code\u003e option is forced\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003enoResolve\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTypeScript should always be able to resolve things. Otherwise, compilation might break.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ewatch\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup, not TypeScript, will watch files if run in watch mode. Efficient caching will still be used for optimum performance.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003epreserveWatchOutput\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following additional options will also be ignored:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eProperty\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReason\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003einclude\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup itself will decide which files to include in the transformation process based on your code. This plugin itself takes a \u003ccode\u003einclude\u003c/code\u003e property which you should use instead if you want to explicitly allow specific files or globs.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexclude\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBehavior of esModuleInterop\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-behavior-of-esmoduleinterop\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Behavior of esModuleInterop\" href=\"#behavior-of-esmoduleinterop\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eGiven that Rollup, not TypeScript, is the decider of which module system(s) to target based on your Rollup configuration, TypeScript will always emit ES modules that Rollup can understand and work with.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eesModuleInterop\u003c/code\u003e option to TypeScript is respected, but its emit-characteristics won't have an impact on your bundle. Instead, you may consult \u003ca href=\"https://rollupjs.org/guide/en/#outputinterop\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ethe Rollup documentation for the \u003ccode\u003einterop\u003c/code\u003e option\u003c/a\u003e to achieve\nthe same thing with Rollup.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eIgnored/overridden Babel options\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-ignoredoverridden-babel-options\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Ignored/overridden Babel options\" href=\"#ignoredoverridden-babel-options\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io/docs/en/options\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBabel options\u003c/a\u003e will be ignored:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eProperty\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReason\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003esourceMaps\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eBabel will always be instructed to produce SourceMaps. Rollup then decides whether or not to include them (and if they should be inlined).\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecwd\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003ecwd\u003c/code\u003e option provided to the plugin will always be used.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003einclude\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup itself will decide which files to include in the transformation process based on your code. This plugin itself takes a \u003ccode\u003einclude\u003c/code\u003e property which you should use instead if you want to explicitly allow specific files or globs.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexclude\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eignore\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eonly\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003esourceType\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eWill always use \u003ccode\u003emodule\u003c/code\u003e. Rollup will then decide what to do based on the output format\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eIgnored/overridden swc options\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-ignoredoverridden-swc-options\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Ignored/overridden swc options\" href=\"#ignoredoverridden-swc-options\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following \u003ca href=\"https://swc.rs/docs/configuration/swcrc\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBabel options\u003c/a\u003e will be ignored:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eProperty\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReason\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003esourceMaps\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eswc will always be instructed to produce SourceMaps. Rollup then decides whether or not to include them (and if they should be inlined).\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecwd\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003ecwd\u003c/code\u003e option provided to the plugin will always be used.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecwd\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003etest\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eRollup itself will decide which files to include in the transformation process based on your code. This plugin itself takes a \u003ccode\u003einclude\u003c/code\u003e property which you should use instead if you want to explicitly allow specific files or globs.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexclude\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSee above\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eisModule\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eWill always use \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e. Rollup will then decide what to do based on the output format\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDefault Babel plugins\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-default-babel-plugins\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Default Babel plugins\" href=\"#default-babel-plugins\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you decide to use Babel as the transpiler with the \u003ccode\u003etranspiler\u003c/code\u003e plugin option set to \u003ccode\u003e\"babel\"\u003c/code\u003e, some best-practice default plugins and presets will be applied such that you don't have to configure anything on your own.\nBy default, the plugin will conditionally apply the \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e preset if a Browserslist is provided or located, as well as plugins for handling \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env#shippedproposals\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eshipped proposals\u003c/a\u003e. And, the \u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-runtime\u003c/code\u003e plugin will be used for extracting Babel helpers and reusing them across your chunks to avoid code duplication.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you provide these presets or plugins yourself through the found or provided Babel config, \u003cem\u003eyour\u003c/em\u003e config options will take precedence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eHere's table with a full overview of the specifics:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003ePreset/Plugin\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eCondition\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReason\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eA Browserslist is provided or found automatically, and you don't provide this preset yourself within your Babel config\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThis preset enables you to base your syntax transformations on the specific browsers/environment you want your application or library to target. It will \"\u003cem\u003eJust Work\"\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-typescript\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eBabel is being used for transforming TypeScript-specific syntax.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThis preset enables you to transform TypeScript-specific syntax. If you declare this in your own babel config, your configuration options will still be respected.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-transform-runtime\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eYou don't provide this plugin yourself within your Babel config\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eDepending on your configuration, async functions may be rewritten to use \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/facebook/regenerator/tree/master/packages/regenerator-runtime\"\u003eRegenerator Runtime\u003c/a\u003e, and there may be one or more Babel helpers injected within your code. \u003ccode\u003e@babel/plugin-runtime\u003c/code\u003e allows this plugin to avoid duplicating these helpers, and instead make them shared across Chunks seamlessly via Rollup.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eContributing\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-contributing\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Contributing\" href=\"#contributing\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDo you want to contribute? Things will work seamlessly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhy wouldn't you use just TypeScript?\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-why-wouldnt-you-use-just-typescript\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Why wouldn't you use just TypeScript?\" href=\"#why-wouldnt-you-use-just-typescript\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe TypeScript compiler, while extremely powerful, has the restriction that it can only target a specific ECMAScript version.\nIn reality, browsers and other ECMAScript environments has varying support for newer language features.\nSome browsers support even those features that haven't been publicized yet, while others support only parts of the latest language features.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn effect, a browser may support a lot of modern features such as classes and proper lexical scoping, but lack others.\nWith TypeScript, it's \u003cem\u003e\"all-or-nothing\"\u003c/em\u003e: If you want to support a Browser with partial support, you must target the latest publicized ECMAScript version that the browser fully supports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBabel, on the other hand, is far more granular in its design and applies syntax transformations on a feature-by-feature basis.\nCombined with something like \u003ccode\u003e@babel/preset-env\u003c/code\u003e, individual transformations can be applied for only those language features that are missing.\nThis means that you can use things like classes and lexical scoping in browsers that otherwise doesn't fully support all of the ES2015 specification.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eOkay, then why wouldn't you use just babel?\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-okay-then-why-wouldnt-you-use-just-babel\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Okay, then why wouldn't you use just babel?\" href=\"#okay-then-why-wouldnt-you-use-just-babel\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25
