3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBabel has support for \u003ca href=\"https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-plugin-transform-typescript\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eparsing and transforming TypeScript\u003c/a\u003e. While Babel can be used for everything, there are some caveats:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe Babel compiler works on a file-by-file basis, meaning it is simple to use and reason about, whereas the TypeScript compiler works with \u003cem\u003ePrograms\u003c/em\u003e, or in other words sets of related \u003cem\u003eSourceFiles\u003c/em\u003e.\nThis gives TypeScript the advantage over Babel that it has a greater understanding of your codebase in general and can understand your types across files.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen combined with Babel, what does TypeScript do, and what does Babel do?\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-when-combined-with-babel-what-does-typescript-do-and-what-does-babel-do\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: When combined with Babel, what does TypeScript do, and what does Babel do?\" href=\"#when-combined-with-babel-what-does-typescript-do-and-what-does-babel-do\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen you use Babel as a transpiler in its default configuration, the TypeScript Compiler will have the responsibility of:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEmitting TypeScript diagnostics\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEmitting TypeScript declaration (\u003ccode\u003e.d.ts\u003c/code\u003e) files and TypeScript declaration map (\u003ccode\u003e.d.ts.map\u003c/code\u003e) files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBabel will then purely perform syntax transformations based on your configuration.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can also opt in to using the TypeScript compiler to remove TypeScript specific syntax from your code when combined with babel. This grants you the power to combine the strengths of the TypeScript compiler,\nwhich understands the structure of your codebase, with the flexibility and plugin ecosystem of Babel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePlease read \u003ca href=\"#mixing-transpilers\"\u003ethis section\u003c/a\u003e for details on how you can mix transpilers to achieve that. In such a setup, TypeScript is also responsible for:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving TypeScript-specific features such as types, type-only imports, enums, and TypeScript decorators.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOther TypeScript features that may require understanding the relationship between your files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBabel will then be used for all other syntax transformation from then on, depending on the combination of default, provided, and forced presets and plugins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen combined with swc, what does TypeScript do, and what does Babel do?\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-when-combined-with-swc-what-does-typescript-do-and-what-does-babel-do\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: When combined with swc, what does width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This is first and foremost a TypeScript plugin for Rollup that brings the best of both together in a package that also respects <a href="https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist">Browserslists</a>, bundles declaration files, and enables seamless integration with other transpilers such as <a href="https://babeljs.io" rel="nofollow">Babel</a> and <a href="https://swc.rs/" rel="nofollow">swc</a>.</p><p dir="auto">One of the most powerful features of <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> is declaration bundling and tree-shaking that works seamlessly with code splitting. That means you'll always get the smallest possible declaration files that match exactly what you're exporting, without any superflous type information.</p><p dir="auto">Tooling in the JavaScript ecosystem can often be complex, and this is very much the case when intending to combine TypeScript with other tools such as Babel and Browserslists while still maintaining the <a href="https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28/hovercard">unique emit capabilities of <code>tsc</code></a>. <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> differs from other TypeScript plugins in being opiniated about how some of these tools integrate in order to achieve the most optimal behavior with the smallest possible computational overhead. For example, when combined with another transpiler such as Babel, TypeScript handles diagnostics and declarations, while Babel is used for part of or all of the syntax transformations. You can even configure which transpiler takes care of the TypeScript-specific syntax, and which transpiler takes care of the remaining syntax. For example, you can let the TypeScript compiler strip away type information, while handling the rest of the syntax transformation with babel or swc.</p><p dir="auto">At the same time, <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> has a very robust test suite that runs tests across all minor versions of TypeScript since v3.4 to ensure that everything works no matter which version of TypeScript you or your team is using.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Features</h3><a id="user-content-features" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Features" href="#features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li>Enables you to bundle your TypeScript applications and libraries with Rollup</li><li>Generates, bundles, and tree-shakes declaration files (<code>.d.ts</code>) and fully supports code splitting.</li><li>Integrates seamlessly with other transpilers such as <a href="https://babeljs.io" rel="nofollow">Babel</a> and <a href="https://swc.rs/" rel="nofollow">swc</a>, such that TypeScript handles diagnostics, declarations, and another transpiler is used for parts of or the entire syntax transformation.</li><li>Emits Compiler diagnostics and brings them into the Rollup build lifecycle</li><li>Correctly handles <a href="https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/rollup/rollup-plugin-typescript/issues/28/hovercard">Emit-less types</a></li><li>Supports Incremental compilation.</li><li>A <a href="https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist">Browserslist</a> can be provided instead of a target version of ECMAScript such that your code is transpiled in relation to the baseline of browsers defined in your Browserslist instead.</li><li>Robust, with a comprehensive test suite that runs against all minor versions of TypeScript from v3.4 and up.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Backers</h2><a id="user-content-backers" class="anchor" 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ pnpm add rollup-plugin-ts --save-dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ pnpm add rollup-plugin-ts --save-dev</code></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Peer Dependencies</h3><a id="user-content-peer-dependencies" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Peer Dependencies" href="#peer-dependencies"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> depends on <code>rollup</code> and <code>typescript</code>, so you need to manually install these as development dependencies as well.</p><p dir="auto">You may also need to install additional peer dependencies such as <code>@babel/core</code>, <code>@babel/runtime</code>, <code>@babel/preset-env</code>, <code>@babel/preset-typescript</code>, <code>@babel/plugin-transform-runtime</code>, <code>@swc/core</code>, or <code>@swc/helpers</code> depending on the features you are going to use. Refer to the documentation for the specific cases where any of these may be relevant.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Usage</h2><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Usage" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Using the plugin is as simple as it can be. Here's an example within a Rollup config:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import ts from "rollup-plugin-ts";export default {// ...plugins: [ts({/* Plugin options */})]};"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">ts</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">"rollup-plugin-ts"</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">default</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c">// ...</span><span class="pl-c1">plugins</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c">/* Plugin options */</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Without any options, the plugin will <em>"just work"</em>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>The <code>tsconfig.json</code> file closest to the current working directory will be resolved, if any. Otherwise, the default Typescript options will be used.</li><li>The <code>.browserslistrc</code> file or <code>browserslist</code> property within the <code>package.json</code> file closest to the current working directory will be resolved and used to decide the Typescript ECMAScript version target, if any. Otherwise, the declared <code>target</code> within the resolved <code>tsconfig.json</code> file will be used, if any such file exists, and if not, the default Typescript target will be used.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Using it with just Typescript</h3><a id="user-content-using-it-with-just-typescript" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Using it with just Typescript" href="#using-it-with-just-typescript"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin works very well with just Typescript.The <code>tsconfig.json</code> file closest to your project will be resolved and used in combination with Rollup.If your config has a different name, or if you use different configs dynamically depending on the environment, you can provide the location for the <code>tsconfig</code> in the plugin options:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({tsconfig: PRODUCTION ? "tsconfig.prod.json" : "tsconfig.json"});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">tsconfig</span>: <span class="pl-c1">PRODUCTION</span> ? <span class="pl-s">"tsconfig.prod.json"</span> : <span class="pl-s">"tsconfig.json"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You an also pass in <a href="https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html" rel="nofollow">CompilerOptions</a> directly, rather than provide the path to a <code>tsconfig</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({tsconfig: {target: ScriptTarget.ES2018,allowSyntheticDefaultImports: true,allowJs: true}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">tsconfig</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">target</span>: <span class="pl-v">ScriptTarget</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">ES2018</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">allowSyntheticDefaultImports</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">allowJs</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can also pass in a function that receives whatever <code>CompilerOptions</code> that could be resolved relative to the current working directory, but then allow you to override the options:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({tsconfig: resolvedConfig => ({...resolvedConfig, allowJs: false})});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-en">tsconfig</span>: <span class="pl-s1">resolvedConfig</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>...<span class="pl-s1">resolvedConfig</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">allowJs</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The above example is based on the assumption that a file can be resolved with the name <code>tsconfig.json</code>, and if not, the Typescript's default <code>CompilerOptions</code> will be used.But if you want to provide the name of the <code>tsconfig</code> to override, you can also pass in an object following the following form:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({tsconfig: {fileName: "my-awesome-tsconfig.json",hook: resolvedConfig => ({...resolvedConfig, allowJs: false})}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">tsconfig</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">fileName</span>: <span class="pl-s">"my-awesome-tsconfig.json"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-en">hook</span>: <span class="pl-s1">resolvedConfig</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>...<span class="pl-s1">resolvedConfig</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">allowJs</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">If there is a <code>.browserslistrc</code> file or the nearest <code>package.json</code> contains a Browserslist configuration, a target ECMAScript version will be decided based on that one, rather than respecting the <code>target</code> property of the matched <code>tsconfig</code>.If you do not want this behavior, you can <a href="#using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists">disable it as described here</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Typescript and tslib helpers</h4><a id="user-content-typescript-and-tslib-helpers" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Typescript and tslib helpers" href="#typescript-and-tslib-helpers"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin makes sure that the helper functions that may be emitted within the output generated by Typescript will not be duplicated across files and chunks. Instead, they will automatically be divided into chunks and imported across Rollup chunks.You don't have to do anything!</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Combining Typescript with a Browserslist</h3><a id="user-content-combining-typescript-with-a-browserslist" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Combining Typescript with a Browserslist" href="#combining-typescript-with-a-browserslist"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If there is a <code>.browserslistrc</code> file or the nearest <code>package.json</code> contains a Browserslist configuration, this is the default behavior! Rather than use the <code>target</code> property of the nearest <code>tsconfig</code>, it will be decided based on the Browserslist.</p><p dir="auto">You can explicitly pass in Browserslist options. Here's an example with a raw Browserslist query:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({browserslist: ["last 1 version", "> 1%"]});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"last 1 version"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">"> 1%"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can also provide a configuration object instead of a raw query. Here's one with a baked-in query:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({browserslist: {query: ["last 1 version", "> 1%"]}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">query</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"last 1 version"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">"> 1%"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">...And here's one with a <code>path</code> property pointing to a file that contains a Browserslist:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({browserslist: {path: ".mybrowserslistrc"}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">path</span>: <span class="pl-s">".mybrowserslistrc"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Using the plugin with Typescript, but without Browserslists</h4><a id="user-content-using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Using the plugin with Typescript, but without Browserslists" href="#using-the-plugin-with-typescript-but-without-browserslists"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If no Browserslist can be found, or if you simply don't want to use one, that's completely OK!In such cases, the <code>target</code> property of the nearest <code>tsconfig</code> will be used (or use the Typescript default setting if no such file exists).</p><p dir="auto">You can explicitly request that no Browserslist will be used by setting the <code>browserslist</code> property to <code>false</code> in the plugin options:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({browserslist: false});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Combining Typescript with Babel</h3><a id="user-content-combining-typescript-with-babel" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Combining Typescript with Babel" href="#combining-typescript-with-babel"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin makes it really easy to use Typescript for reporting diagnostics and generating declaration files, but then using Babel for all syntax transformations.One very strong use case for this is to use <a href="https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env" rel="nofollow"><code>@babel/preset-env</code></a>. Another one is that you get the entire ecosystem of Babel plugins at your disposal.</p><p dir="auto">To use Babel, first set the <code>transpiler</code> plugin option to <code>"babel"</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({transpiler: "babel"});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">transpiler</span>: <span class="pl-s">"babel"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now, all that remains is to simply install the peer dependencies relevant to <code>babel</code>. Please install <code>@babel/core</code>, <code>@babel/runtime</code>, <code>@babel/plugin-transform-runtime</code>, <code>@babel/preset-typescript</code>, and <code>@babel/preset-env</code> as well with your package manager:</p><p dir="auto"><strong>npm</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm install @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ npm install @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Yarn</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ yarn add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ yarn add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>pnpm</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ pnpm add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ pnpm add @babel/core @babel/runtime @babel/plugin-transform-runtime @babel/preset-typescript @babel/preset-env --save-dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Don't worry if you don't, <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> will warn you about exactly which dependencies are missing once you run it.</p><p dir="auto">Once you're done installing peer dependencies, that's it! The plugin will attempt to locate a <code>babel.config.js</code> file or a <code>.babelrc</code> file and use the options, plugins, and presets found there.By default, some combination of presets and plugins will be applied depending on the config options you provide, while others will be forced at all times for interoperability reasons. See <a href="#default-babel-plugins">this section</a> for more details.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>@babel/preset-env</code> behavior (and how to opt out)</h4><a id="user-content-babelpreset-env-behavior-and-how-to-opt-out" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: @babel/preset-env behavior (and how to opt out)" href="#babelpreset-env-behavior-and-how-to-opt-out"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, when using Babel as the transpiler, <code>@babel/preset-env</code> will be used as a preset that respects the browserslist that was either provided directly as a plugin option, or was resolved inside the root of your project, or was computed based on your <code>tsconfig.json</code> file.</p><p dir="auto">If you don't want this behavior, simply pass the <code>browserslist: false</code> option to the plugin. Doing so will never apply <code>@babel/preset-env</code> and not apply any additional syntax transformations:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({transpiler: "babel",browserslist: false});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">transpiler</span>: <span class="pl-s">"babel"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Special handling for minification plugins/presets</h4><a id="user-content-special-handling-for-minification-pluginspresets" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Special handling for minification plugins/presets" href="#special-handling-for-minification-pluginspresets"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin will apply syntax transformations from Babel presets and plugins on a file-by-file basis. However, if a minification-related plugin or preset such as <a href="https://github.com/babel/minify/tree/master/packages/babel-preset-minify">babel-preset-minify</a> is found within the Babel options,these transformations will be applied per chunk. This enables the minification presets and plugins to perform better as it can now mangle in relation to the entire chunk and better remove unwanted characters such as whitespace.All of this works automatically.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>@babel/runtime</code> and external helpers</h4><a id="user-content-babelruntime-and-external-helpers" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: @babel/runtime and external helpers" href="#babelruntime-and-external-helpers"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin will automatically make sure to avoid duplication of emitted Babel helpers. Rollup will automatically split these into chunks and re-use them across the chunks that Rollup generates.You don't have to do anything.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>@babel/runtime</code> and polyfills</h4><a id="user-content-babelruntime-and-polyfills" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: @babel/runtime and polyfills" href="#babelruntime-and-polyfills"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Babel supports injecting polyfills where needed and in relation to the target environment. By default, this plugin <strong>will not</strong> add polyfills to your chunks since there are arguably better ways of applying polyfills such as lazy-loading depending on feature support or using something like <a href="https://github.com/wessberg/polyfiller">Polyfill.app</a>.If you would like this behavior, simply add either <code>@babel/plugin-transform-runtime</code> to your Babel config with the <code>corejs</code> option set to true, or add <code>@babel/preset-env</code> to your Babel config with the <code>useBuiltIns</code> option set to <code>usage</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Combining Typescript with swc</h3><a id="user-content-combining-typescript-with-swc" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Combining Typescript with swc" href="#combining-typescript-with-swc"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Just like with <a href="#combining-typescript-with-babel">Babel</a>, this plugin makes it trivial to use TypeScript for reporting diagnostics, generating declaration files, and stripping types, but then using swc for all other syntax transformations.</p><p dir="auto">Swc is a much faster alternative to Babel, built in Rust, that attempts to be as close to a drop-in replacement for Babel as possible. It is not nearly as mature and doesn't have as big a plugin ecosystem yet, but can often be much faster than Babel. And like Babel, it also has <a href="https://swc.rs/docs/configuration/supported-browsers" rel="nofollow">first-class support for Browserslists</a> which will be used to decide which syntax transformations to apply depending on language support in the target environments.</p><p dir="auto">To use swc, first set the <code>transpiler</code> plugin option to <code>"swc"</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({transpiler: "swc"});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">transpiler</span>: <span class="pl-s">"swc"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now, all that remains is to simply install the peer dependencies relevant to <code>swc</code>. Please install <code>@swc/core</code> and <code>@swc/helpers</code> as well with your package manager:</p><p dir="auto"><strong>npm</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm install @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ npm install @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Yarn</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ yarn add @swc/core @swc/helpers --dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ yarn add @swc/core @swc/helpers --dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>pnpm</strong></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ pnpm add @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev"><pre class="notranslate"><code>$ pnpm add @swc/core @swc/helpers --save-dev</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Don't worry if you don't, <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> will warn you about exactly which dependencies are missing once you run it.</p><p dir="auto">Once you're done installing peer dependencies, that's it! The plugin will attempt to locate a <code>.swcrc</code> file and use the options found there.By default, some combination of options will be applied depending on the config options you provide, while others will be forced at all times for interoperability reasons. See <a href="#default-babel-plugins">this section</a> for more details.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Mixing transpilers</h3><a id="user-content-mixing-transpilers" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Mixing transpilers" href="#mixing-transpilers"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, the transpiler you select, such as <code>typescript</code>, <code>babel</code>, or <code>swc</code>, is used for the entire syntax transformation. However, you may want to mix these. There can be quite good reasons why you may want that, <a href="#okay-then-why-wouldnt-you-use-just-babel">as described here</a>.In short, you may find value in using the TypeScript compiler for stripping away the TypeScript specific syntax, and then delegate the remaining syntax transformations to swc or babel.</p><p dir="auto">To accomplish this, the <code>transpiler</code> option also allows for an options record:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({transpiler: {typescriptSyntax: "typescript",otherSyntax: "babel"}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">transpiler</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">typescriptSyntax</span>: <span class="pl-s">"typescript"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">otherSyntax</span>: <span class="pl-s">"babel"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">In this example, the TypeScript compiler will first remove features such as types, type-only imports, enums, and decorators.Babel will then be used for all other syntax transformation from then on, depending on the combination of default, provided, and forced presets and plugins.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Using <code>Custom Transformers</code></h3><a id="user-content-using-custom-transformers" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Using Custom Transformers" href="#using-custom-transformers"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin enables you to pass in <a href="https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/13940" data-hovercard-type="pull_request" data-hovercard-url="/microsoft/TypeScript/pull/13940/hovercard"><code>Custom Transformers</code></a> which allows you to transform the Typescript AST during code transpilation.This enables you to very efficiently transform Typescript before code generation and additionally enables you to use this plugin with tools that leverage this, such as some modern web frameworks and libraries do.</p><p dir="auto">Please note that if you want to combine Custom Transformers with other transpilers such as <code>babel</code>, you must mix them such that the <code>typeScript</code> transpiler is used for the <code>typescriptSyntax</code> option as <a href="#mixing-transpilers">described above</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Declaration files</h2><a id="user-content-declaration-files" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Declaration files" href="#declaration-files"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Typescript declaration files are normally distributed in a folder structure that resembles the structure of the source folder.With <code>tsc</code>, you would get something like this:</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/tsc-output-example.png"><img alt="TSC emitted code" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/tsc-output-example.png" height="250" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">Rollup is a bundler, and with it, we can produce clean, small files that are easy to distribute.With <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code>, declaration files will be bundled, tree-shaken and emitted alongside the chunks emitted by Rollup:</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example.png"><img alt="Plugin emitted code" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example.png" height="250" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">And, it even works in complex code splitting scenarios:</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example-code-splitting.png"><img alt="Plugin emitted code with code splitting" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessberg/rollup-plugin-ts/master/documentation/asset/plugin-output-example-code-splitting.png" height="250" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">if you're using TypeScript v4.7 or newer, the extension of your declaration files will depend on the extensions of your output files as controlled by your Rollup config:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>.js</code> output files will produce <code>.d.ts</code> and optionally <code>.d.ts.map</code> files</li><li><code>.mjs</code> output files will produce <code>.d.mts</code> and optionally <code>.d.mts.map</code> files</li><li><code>.cjs</code> output files will produce <code>.d.cts</code> and optionally <code>.d.cts.map</code> files</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Examples</h2><a id="user-content-examples" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Examples" href="#examples"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Pure Typescript example</h3><a id="user-content-pure-typescript-example" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Pure Typescript example" href="#pure-typescript-example"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" production</span><span class="pl-c1">tsconfig</span>: <span class="pl-c1">IS_PRODUCTION</span> ? <span class="pl-s">"tsconfig.prod.json"</span> : <span class="pl-s">"tsconfig.json"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c">// Load a different browserslist if currently targeting a modern environment</span><span class="pl-c1">browserslist</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">path</span>: <span class="pl-c1">BUNDLE_TARGET</span> <span class="pl-c1">===</span> <span class="pl-s">"modern"</span> ? <span class="pl-s">".browserslistrc-modern"</span> : <span class="pl-s">".browserslistrc-legacy"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c">// Load a different babel config file in production</span><span class="pl-c1">babelConfig</span>: <span class="pl-c1">IS_PRODUCTION</span> ? <span class="pl-s">"babel.config.prod.js"</span> : <span class="pl-s">"babel.config.js"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c">// Exclude files within node_modules when not in production</span><span class="pl-c1">exclude</span>: <span class="pl-c1">IS_PRODUCTION</span> ? <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> : <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">"node_modules/**/*.*"</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c">// Apply CustomTransformers, for example to transform the Source Code with a framework that uses some</span><span class="pl-c1">transformers</span>: <span class="pl-s1">awesomeFrameworkTransformers</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Passing a specific TypeScript version</h3><a id="user-content-passing-a-specific-typescript-version" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Passing a specific TypeScript version" href="#passing-a-specific-typescript-version"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 TypeScript to use as an option. This may be useful if you are using different TypeScript versions across packages inside a monorepo and you want to use a specific one with <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({typescript: specialTypescriptVersion});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">typescript</span>: <span class="pl-s1">specialTypescriptVersion</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Hooks</h2><a id="user-content-hooks" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Hooks" href="#hooks"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 that allow you to hook into and augment the internal behavior of the plugin.</p><p dir="auto">These can be provided in the plugin options for the <code>hook</code> property:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({hook: {// Add hooks here}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">hook</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c">// Add hooks here</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The next few subsections describe the different hooks that can be provided</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The <code>outputPath</code> hook</h3><a id="user-content-the-outputpath-hook" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: The outputPath hook" href="#the-outputpath-hook"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Type: <code>(path: string, kind: "declaration" | "declarationMap" | "buildInfo") => string | undefined</code></p><p dir="auto">The <code>outputPath</code> hook can be used to rewrite the location on the filesystem that assets produced by <code>rollup-plugin-ts</code> are written to.It is invoked immediately before assets such as <em>declarations</em> or <em>declaration maps</em> are emitted.</p><p dir="auto">The hook is invoked with the output path as well as the kind of asset the path represents as arguments.If you return a <code>string</code> from the hook, the alternative location will be used instead. If you return undefined, the current path will be used.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({hook: {outputPath: (path, kind) => rewritePathSomehow(path, kind)}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">hook</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-en">outputPath</span>: <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">kind</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-en">rewritePathSomehow</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">kind</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">For example, the <code>path</code> may be <code>/some/path/index.d.ts</code>, and <code>kind</code> be <code>declaration</code>, and you might want to rewrite this to <code>/some/path/my-typings.d.ts</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The <code>diagnostics</code> hook</h3><a id="user-content-the-diagnostics-hook" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: The diagnostics hook" href="#the-diagnostics-hook"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Type: <code>(diagnostics: readonly Diagnostic[]) => readonly Diagnostic[]|undefined</code></p><p dir="auto">The <code>diagnostics</code> hook can be used to read, alter, and extend the diagnostics generated by TypeScript immediately before they are emitted as errors via Rollup.Normally, Rollup will crash on the first discovered error, but there may be several diagnostics, all of which may be of interest to you. This hook gives you access to all of them.</p><p dir="auto">You can also use this hook if you want to silence specific kinds of Diagnostics or even add your own.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The <code>declarationStats</code> hook</h3><a id="user-content-the-declarationstats-hook" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: The declarationStats hook" href="#the-declarationstats-hook"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Type: <code>(stats: DeclarationStats) => DeclarationStats|undefined</code></p><p dir="auto">The <code>declarationStats</code> hook can be used to get relevant stats produced while bundling declarations.The hook calls the given callback with a stats object as the first argument.The stats object has the following type information:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// A Record from chunk file names to their statstype DeclarationStats = Record<string, DeclarationChunkStats>;interface DeclarationChunkStats {// An array of the external type dependencies for a declaration chunkexternalTypes: ExternalType[];}interface ExternalType {// The name of the external library that provides the typings. For example, "typescript" or "@types/node"library: string;// The version of the referenced external libraryversion: string;}"><pre><span class="pl-c">// A Record from chunk file names to their stats</span><span class="pl-k">type</span> <span class="pl-smi">DeclarationStats</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">Record</span><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-smi">string</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-smi">DeclarationChunkStats</span><span class="pl-kos">></span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">interface</span> <span class="pl-smi">DeclarationChunkStats</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c">// An array of the external type dependencies for a declaration chunk</span><span class="pl-c1">externalTypes</span>: <span class="pl-smi">ExternalType</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-k">interface</span> <span class="pl-smi">ExternalType</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c">// The name of the external library that provides the typings. For example, "typescript" or "@types/node"</span><span class="pl-c1">library</span>: <span class="pl-smi">string</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-c">// The version of the referenced external library</span><span class="pl-c1">version</span>: <span class="pl-smi">string</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h5 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The <code>externalTypes</code> property for <code>DeclarationChunkStats</code></h5><a id="user-content-the-externaltypes-property-for-declarationchunkstats" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: The externalTypes property for DeclarationChunkStats" href="#the-externaltypes-property-for-declarationchunkstats"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 declaration chunk stats objects can be useful, for example, if you want to get a hook into which external type dependencies that remainafter bundling and tree-shaking and that you should declare as <code>dependencies</code> of your library.</p><p dir="auto">Here's an example of how you might use the hook:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ts({hook: {declarationStats: declarationStats => console.log(declarationStats)}});"><pre><span class="pl-en">ts</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">hook</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-en">declarationStats</span>: <span class="pl-s1">declarationStats</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">declarationStats</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The example above could log something like the following to the console:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  "index.d.ts": {    externalTypes: [      { library: "typescript", version: "3.9.2" },      { library: "@types/node", version: "14.0.26" }    ]  },  "some-other-chunk.d.ts": {    externalTypes: [      { library: "some-other-external-library", version: "1.2.3" }    ]  }}"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-s">"index.d.ts"</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">externalTypes</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span>      <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">library</span>: <span class="pl-s">"typescript"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">version</span>: <span class="pl-s">"3.9.2"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>      <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">library</span>: <span class="pl-s">"@types/node"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">version</span>: <span class="pl-s">"14.0.26"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>    <span class="pl-kos">]</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-s">"some-other-chunk.d.ts"</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">externalTypes</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span>      <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">library</span>: <span class="pl-s">"some-other-external-library"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">version</span>: <span class="pl-s">"1.2.3"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>    <span class="pl-kos">]</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This gives you an easy way to track which external type dependencies remain in your bundled and tree-shaken declarations and that should be declared as dependencies of your library.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Full list of plugin options</h2><a 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The plugin options are documented in more detail across this README, but the full list of options is:</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>transpiler</code></h4><a id="user-content-transpiler" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: transpiler" href="#transpiler"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Type: <code>"typescript" | "babel" | "swc"| {typescriptSyntax: "typescript" | "babel" | "swc"; otherSyntax: "typescript" | "babel" | "swc"}</code></p><p dir="auto">Can be any of <code>"babel"</code>, <code>"swc"</code>, or <code>"typescript"</code> (default: <code>"typescript"</code>).Alternatively, it can be an options object with properties <code>typescriptSyntax</code> and <code>otherSyntax</code>, where any of the aforementioned transpilers can be used in combination.See <a href="#mixing-transpilers">this section</a> for details on how to combine transpilers.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>babelConfig</code></h4><a
